newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft Corp rises.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft Corp rises.

text.p: Computer software giant Microsoft Corp rose to 100 in after-hours trading following the release of its third-quarter earnings, dealers said Thursday.
Microsoft, whose stock closed at 98-3/8 on the Nasdaq, reported a profit of $0.79 a share against $0.44 for the same period a year ago.
The figure also surpassed the $0.64-a-share estimate by First Call's analyst consensus.
One of the traders said Microsoft's stock price later rose again to 102-3/4 amid active trading.
Iomega Corp and Office Depot Inc were also moving heavily, he said.
"Those are the ones that are hot," he said, referring to the three stocks.
Iomega was up to 17-7/8 on a close of 17-5/8 on the New York Stock Exchange, while Office Depot was trading at 14-1/8 against a close of 13-5/8.
Iomega reported a first-quarter profit of $0.17 a share against $0.08 for the same period a year ago and Office Depot had a $0.24-a-share profit against $0.21.
Both companies surpassed the earnings estimates set out by First Call's analyst consensus.
The consensus had $0.13 a share for Iomega and $0.22 for Office Depot.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 26,700 shares against the previous day's 1,900 and session two had 920,637 shares against 3,695,588.
